intro: Urostemon kirkii var. kirkii, commonly known as Kirk's urostemon, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and lobed leaves. Its flowers are usually pale pink to white, with five petals and a prominent central column. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grassland or woodland habitats.
